title: Firefox won’t open on my desktop, just an error message
content: Error message is XULRunner Error:Platform version’121.0’ is not compatible with Min version>=120.01 Max version<=120.01
creator: d.bott5

title: Missing "restore closed tab" Button in Toolbar
content: I use Firefox on my Win11 and Win10 PCs. The Win11 version of Firefox has a button to restore the recent closed button, but the Win10 version doesn't. I wonder why?

title: No Comments from TownHall VIP Membership
content:
I run Firefox 121.0 on Windows 10 Pro. I use a VPN (ExpressVPN) and normally run Ghostery and uBlock Origin. When I log onto Townhall.com and enter my VIP credentials all is fine. However, when I read an article I should be able to access the comments. I cannot in Firefox and this is something that has occurred about 3-4 weeks ago. For years I have not had any problem like this with Firefox.

I tested VIP access with my iPhone - works fine. I tried Vivaldi - works fine. I tried Chrome - works fine. I try Firefox - fails!

I ran Firefox in "TroubleShoot" mode, with all add-ons turned off and it also fails. Even when I run Vivaldi I have Ghostery and ad blocking turned on, but Ghostery does allow townhall.com on their whitelist.

I've send emails to Townhall.com and am not getting any responses. However, I was having the issue with all devices but all have been fixed except with Firefox. So, I have no idea why this is an issue with Firefox but not with any other device.

Any thoughts?
creator: BPaul_H

title: Trojan:HTML/Phish!pz
content:
Below are communication I have had with both Glarysoft Support and Hideaway VPN by Firetrust Limited. I have narrowed the issue of detection of Trojan:HTML/Phish!pz by MS Defender While running Glary Utilities. (see screenshot).

Jeremy, Thank you for your rapid response. I connected to 3 different VPN servers, and used the link you provided (https://user-support.firetrust.com/Tickets/Reply/36314) below via Firefox, Chrome, and Edge. Connections to Seattle, Dallas, and Washington DC all produced the same result as before ONLY with Firefox. The issue WAS NOT reproduced by Chrome or Edge. I hope this helps resolve the problem because, I have issues with both Edge and Chrome. Particularly with their self-serving propensities.

Rodman L Browning [edited] @hotmail.com ________________________________________ -System: -Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3770 CPU @ 3.40GHz 3.40 GHz -Installed RAM: 32.0 GB -Device ID 3B29AE3B-C784-4651-9123-A91B7C41393A -Product ID 00330-80000-00000-AA737 -System OS: Windows 10 Pro 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor - -MS Defender v1.403.1528.0 -Created 1/2/2024 3:58am -Last updated 01/02/2024 11:51am - -Glary Utilities Pro v6.4.0.7 -VPN: Hideaway by Firetrust Limited v4.20.4

- - This MS Defender notice occurred during a 1-Click Maintenance/Temporary File Cleaner; - file: C:\Users\Rodman\AppData\Local\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\wg6stjgb.default-release-1640201893394 \cache2\entries\08D20F0659D23D2EF0621F044374EA076FED5146 -An immediate 1-Click Maintenance/Temporary File Cleaner produces no notices (I assume because the Trojan has been quarantined). However, on further investigation I discovered that this notice occurs when the VPN (Hideaway by -Firetrust Limited) is active. Turning off the VPN then opening Firefox and visiting the same site produced "No notice" from MS Defender during a 1-Click Maintenance/Temporary File Cleaner procedure. -Therefore, I am CCing a copy of this to Hideaway Support. Please contact them ([edited] @firetrust.com) to see if together a resolution can be obtained. -

From: Firetrust Support <[edited] @firetrust.com> Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 4:52 PM To: [edited] @hotmail.com Subject: New reply added to Ticket # 36314 - Trojan:HTML/Phish!pz on version 6.4.0.7 Pro - Further investigation

  1. -- Please type your reply above this line --#

Hi there, Yes, that is odd, as nothing in Hideaway itself could cause this, possibly however it is due to the IP address of the server you are connected to via Hideaway?

You can see what IP address it is in Hideaway while it is connected on the main Hideaway screen, eg the below screenshot for the NZ server:

You can reply to this email to add your response or you can view/answer the ticket by clicking here: https://user-support.firetrust.com/Tickets/Reply/36314 .

Jeremy Clark :. Firetrust Support firetrust INTERNET SECURITY Christchurch, New Zealand www.firetrust.com

title: Launch parallel independent firefox instances
content:
Hi I need to run multiple firefox instances, each with a dedicated profile The following used to work before version 121 on MacOS: /Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox-bin -no-remote -p &

The above method is not perfect, but it works. Since Firefox upgraded to 121, the above method stopped working.

Any way to launch multiple instances as before? Hate to switch to Chrome, but Chrome allow you to switch easily.
creator: Riordan

title: Unable to redeem Microsoft rewards since late June.
content:
The title says it all. Microsoft writes back stating no voip phones, no VPN, no multiple users, no searching in multiple markets. I do NONE of those things, and NEVER have. I have a feeling it is somehow in my Firefox settings, although they are not looking amiss to me; or perhaps when my cellular company went to full time 5G (Google Pixel 6;) it is US Cellular (USA) and I've never had a problem before.

I get all of the way to the confirmation screen (with my phone number.) When I click it says "there is a problem with my account of ofer."

I got a new to me laptop in February, and about a month later windows 11 was auto downloaded. I use Ublock Origin, and Privacy Possum (they were never a problem prior to June) and have disabled them to try to redeem. I have tried with Chrome, Edge, and Bing on Firefox, on my PC. Bing on Firefox, and Chrome on my phone. I talked to Google, US Cellular, and (my ISP) Spectrum; all say they do not have settings which would cause the problem. I am at my wits end, many other folks are complaining of this too. Please help.
creator: newsie2000
